bst

Class BinaryTree<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bst.BinaryTree<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinarySearchTree

    public class BinaryTree<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class for a binary tree that stores type E objects.
    Author:
    Koffman and Wolfgang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryTree()
      Construct an empty BinaryTree
      BinaryTree(E data, BinaryTree<E> leftTree, BinaryTree<E> rightTree)
      Constructs a new binary tree with data in its root,leftTree as its left subtree and rightTree as its right subtree.

      • preorderToString

        public java.lang.String preorderToString()

        A preorder traversal as a string

      • postorderToString

        public java.lang.String postorderToString()

        Returns:
        A postorder traversal as a string

      • inorderToString

        public java.lang.String inorderToString()
        A method to display the inorder traversal of a binary tree placeing a left parenthesis before each subtree and a right parenthesis after each subtree. For example the expression tree shown in Figure 6.12 would be represented as (((x) + (y)) * ((a) / (b))).
        Returns:
        An inorder string representation of the tree
